intro: Landolphia hispidula, commonly known as the rough horsewhin, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
